servinfo.title: Compression Check
servinfo.ptxt: Check compression pressure on all 6 cylinders as follows:

s1.ptxt: Remove surge tank cover and disconnect ignition coil harness couplers.
Remove all ignition coils (1) and spark plugs (2) referring to Spark Plug Removal and Installation .
Disconnect fuel injector wire harness at connector.
Install special tool (Compression gauge) into spark plug hole.
Disengage clutch (to lighten starting load on engine) for M/T vehicle, and depress accelerator pedal all the way to make throttle fully open.
Crank engine with fully charged battery, and read the highest pressure on compression gauge.

attention3.ptxt: For measuring compression pressure, crank engine at least 250 rpm by using fully charged battery.

spec.title: Compression pressure
spec.ptxt: Max. difference between any two cylinders: 100 kPa (1.0 kg/cm², 14.2 psi)

s1.ptxt: Carry out steps 6), 7) and 8) on each cylinder to obtain 6 readings.
